00008 static void bootothers(void);
00009 static void mpmain(void) __attribute__((noreturn));
00010 
00011 // Bootstrap processor starts running C code here.
00012 int
00013 main(void)
00014 {
00015   mpinit(); // collect info about this machine
00016   lapicinit(mpbcpu());
00017   ksegment();
00018   picinit();       // interrupt controller
00019   ioapicinit();    // another interrupt controller
00020   consoleinit();   // I/O devices & their interrupts
00021   uartinit();      // serial port
00022 cprintf("cpus %p cpu %p\n", cpus, cpu);
00023   cprintf("\ncpu%d: starting xv6\n\n", cpu->id);
00024 
00025   kinit();         // physical memory allocator
00026   pinit();         // process table
00027   tvinit();        // trap vectors
00028   binit();         // buffer cache
00029   fileinit();      // file table
00030   iinit();         // inode cache
00031   ideinit();       // disk
00032   if(!ismp)
00033     timerinit();   // uniprocessor timer
00034   userinit();      // first user process
00035   bootothers();    // start other processors
00036 
00037   // Finish setting up this processor in mpmain.
00038   mpmain();
00039 }
00040 
00041 // Bootstrap processor gets here after setting up the hardware.
00042 // Additional processors start here.
00043 static void
00044 mpmain(void)
00045 {
00046   if(cpunum() != mpbcpu())
00047     lapicinit(cpunum());
00048   ksegment();
00049   cprintf("cpu%d: mpmain\n", cpu->id);
00050   idtinit();
00051   xchg(&cpu->booted, 1);
00052 
00053   cprintf("cpu%d: scheduling\n", cpu->id);
00054   scheduler();
00055 }
00056 
00057 static void
00058 bootothers(void)
00059 {
00060   extern uchar _binary_bootother_start[], _binary_bootother_size[];
00061   uchar *code;
00062   struct cpu *c;
00063   char *stack;
00064 
00065   // Write bootstrap code to unused memory at 0x7000.
00066   code = (uchar*)0x7000;
00067   memmove(code, _binary_bootother_start, (uint)_binary_bootother_size);
00068 
00069   for(c = cpus; c < cpus+ncpu; c++){
00070     if(c == cpus+cpunum())  // We've started already.
00071       continue;
00072 
00073     // Fill in %esp, %eip and start code on cpu.
00074     stack = kalloc(KSTACKSIZE);
00075     *(void**)(code-4) = stack + KSTACKSIZE;
00076     *(void**)(code-8) = mpmain;
00077     lapicstartap(c->id, (uint)code);
00078 
00079     // Wait for cpu to get through bootstrap.
00080     while(c->booted == 0)
00081       ;
00082   }
00083 }
